conclusion: To determine how the objects A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves upward, we need to consider the principles of light and shadow in 3D space.
The light source is positioned above the slabs, casting shadows on the ground.
The objects are placed on the ground, with shadows cast by each object.
When the light source moves upward, the shadows will change in size and position.
The objects will appear to move in the direction of the light source.
The size of the shadows will increase as the light source moves upward.
The objects will appear to be larger in the direction of the light source.
The shadows will shift to the right and upward.
The shadow of the apple will increase in size and shift to the right and upward.
The apple will appear larger in the direction of the light source.
The shadow of the white sheet will increase in size and shift to the right and upward.
The sheet will appear larger in the direction of the light source.
The shadow of the chicken leg will increase in size and shift to the right and upward.
The leg will appear larger in the direction of the light source.
The shadow of the chicken drumstick will increase in size and shift to the right and upward.
The drumstick will appear larger in the direction of the light source.
When the light source moves upward, the shadows of all objects will increase in size and shift to the right and upward. The objects will appear larger in the direction of the light source.
